nodes.text: Dhen-Moh was a location where the Galactic Empire ordered a genocide. Darth Vader notably took part in the atrocity, which the defecting Imperial Governor Everi Chalis mentioned to Hazram Namir, a First Sergeant in the Rebel Alliance's 61st Mobile Infantry in 3 ABY.

Some weeks after the Battle of Endor in 4 ABY, Yrica Quell, an Imperial pilot who had defected to the Alliance's successor, the New Republic, considered the difference between the Dhen-Moh genocides and Operation: Cinder, another genocide ordered by the Empire, as that between ruthlessness and cruetly.
Dhen-Moh was first mentioned in the 2015 novel Battlefront: Twilight Company, written by Alexander Freed.
